com.net2plan.libraries

Class WDMUtils.RSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.net2plan.libraries.WDMUtils.RSA
  • Enclosing class:
    WDMUtils

    public static class WDMUtils.RSA
extends Object
    This class represents a Routing and Spectrum Assignment, valid for a lightpath in both fixed and flexi-grid WDM networks. This comprises a sequence of links, and for each link the set of frequency slots occupied, and for each traversed node but the first, whether or not the optical signal goes through an optical signal regeneration (and thus, a regenerator should be allocated there for this). The number of slots occupied is the same in all the traversed links.

      List<Link> seqLinks
      The sequence of traversed fibers
      int[] seqRegeneratorsOccupancy_e

    • Field Detail

      • egressNode

        public final Node egressNode
        The end node of the lightpath

      • ingressNode

        public final Node ingressNode
        The initial node of the lightpath

      • seqFrequencySlots_se

        public final IntMatrix2D seqFrequencySlots_se
        A 2D integer matrix with as many columns as traversed links (in the same order), and rows as the number of frequency slots occupied (the same in all the links). Position (i,j) of the array is the identifier of the i-th slot used in the fiber traversed in the j-th place. Recall that an slot identifier is an integer number between zero and the number of slots in the grid minus one.

      • seqLinks

        public final List<Link> seqLinks
        The sequence of traversed fibers

      • seqRegeneratorsOccupancy_e

        public final int[] seqRegeneratorsOccupancy_e
        An integer vector with one coordinate per traversed fiber. A 1 is set in the i-th position if a regenerator is needed at origin node of the fiber traversed in the i-th place, and a 0 otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RSA

        public RSA(List<Link> seqLinks,
           int occupiedSlotId)
        Creates a RSA where the same one single slot is occupied in all the traversed links. Typically used in fixed-grid networks without wavelength conversion. Equivalent to RSA (seqLinks , occupiedSlotId , 1)
        Parameters:
        seqLinks - sequence of traversed fibers
        occupiedSlotId - the slot occupied

      • RSA

        public RSA(List<Link> seqLinks,
           int initialSlot,
           int numSlots)
        Creates a RSA with the same set of contigous slots occupied in all the traversed fibers
        Parameters:
        seqLinks - Sequence of traversed fiber
        initialSlot - id of the initial frequency slot occupied
        numSlots - number of contiguous slots of the RSA

      • RSA

        public RSA(List<Link> seqLinks,
           int initialSlot,
           int numSlots,
           int[] seqRegenerators_e)
        Creates a RSA with the same set of contigous slots occupied in all the traversed fibers
        Parameters:
        seqLinks - Sequence of traversed fiber
        initialSlot - id of the initial frequency slot occupied
        numSlots - number of contiguous slots of the RSA
        seqRegenerators_e - vector with the sequence of traversed regenerators information (if null, no regenerators are placed)

      • RSA

        public RSA(List<Link> seqLinks,
           IntMatrix2D seqFrequencySlots_se)
        Equivalent to RSA (seqLinks , seqFrequencySlot, null)
        Parameters:
        seqLinks - sequence of traversed fibers (a copy is made internally)
        seqFrequencySlots_se - 2D array with the sequence of frequency slots information.

      • RSA

        public RSA(List<Link> seqLinks,
           IntMatrix2D seqFrequencySlots_se,
           int[] seqRegenerators_e)
        Creates a RSA object from the provided information
        Parameters:
        seqLinks - sequence of traversed fibers (a copy is made internally)
        seqFrequencySlots_se - 2D array with the sequence of frequency slots information.
        seqRegenerators_e - vector with the sequence of traversed regenerators information (if null, no regenerators are placed)

      • RSA

        public RSA(ProtectionSegment r)
        Creates a RSA object reading the information from the existing ProtectionSegment object (and its WDM-related attributes).
        Parameters:
        r - the segment object

      • RSA

        public RSA(Route r,
           boolean initializeWithTheInitialRoute)
        Creates a RSA object reading the information from the existing Route object (and its WDM-related attributes).
        Parameters:
        r - the route object
        initializeWithTheInitialRoute - if true, the RSA object created gets the information from the route initial sequence of links, and if not, from the route current sequence of traversed links.

    • Method Detail

      • checkFrequencySlotConversionOccupiesARegenerator

        public void checkFrequencySlotConversionOccupiesARegenerator()
        Checks that in every node where the frequency slots of the RSA change, a regenerator is placed (if not, an exception is raised). This is assuming that regenerators are the equipment needed to perform wavelength/frequency slot conversion

      • getLengthInKm

        public double getLengthInKm()
        Gets the length of the RSA in km, summing the length of the traversed fibers
        Returns:
        the length in km

      • getNodesWithFrequencySlotConversion

        public List<Node> getNodesWithFrequencySlotConversion()
        Gets the list of nodes (in the same order as they are traversed) where frequency slot changes in the RSA.
        Returns:
        a list of nodes where frequency slot changes (it is assumed that devices making frequency slot conversion were placed there)

      • getNumSlots

        public int getNumSlots()
        Gets the number of slots occupied in this RSA (the same in all the traversed fibers)
        Returns:
        the number of slots

      • getSignalRegenerationNodes

        public List<Node> getSignalRegenerationNodes()
        Gets the list of nodes (in the same order as they are traversed) where a regenerator has been placed.
        Returns:
        the list of nodes where regenerators have been placed, according to seqRegeneratorsOccupancy_e

      • hasFrequencySlotConversions

        public boolean hasFrequencySlotConversions()
        Returns whether or not frequency slot conversions occur in this RSA (and thus converters would be needed)
        Returns:
        true if frequency slot conversion occurs, false otherwise

      • isFrequencySlotContiguous

        public boolean isFrequencySlotContiguous()
        Returns true if in ALL the links, the slots occupied are contigous (e.g. slots 12,13,14 are contiguous), or false otherwise (p.e. if in a link it occupied slots 12, 16, 17, they are not contigous and returns false). Note that is frequency slots occupied are not the same in all the links, but inside eachlink they are contigous, the method returns true
        Returns:
        true if frequency slots occupied are contiguous in all the links
